text:
Hey everyone, if you have an E-Commerce or Direct To Consumer Business or serve such businesses or use Google Ads, this will be hugely valuable for you. I've been working on this for months along with the agency owner who's experience this is.

It's a detailed growth study about how he helped an Ecom D2C business reach $2mm+ revenue through Google Ads.

Here's a short summary of takeaways for you -

1> Learn the right way to track the right metrics - Traffic, Purchase Value, and Micro-conversions - using both Google Analytics and Google Ads.
2> Analyze the customer buyer journey and use this to understand how well your ad campaigns are performing.
3> Discover the number one reason for wasted ad-spend: Poor organization!
4>Optimize every layer of the campaign by performing a detailed analysis of Campaigns, Ad Groups, Ads, and Keywords.
5> Implement the best retargeting techniques and start scaling up your returns.

<https://www.octobermarketing.com/2mm-growth-ecom-google-ads/>

Oh and if you've got questions comment on there, he'll be answering himself :slightly_smiling_face:

attachments.title: [Growth Study] $2,848,821 For A Direct-To-Consumer Ecommerce Brand Using Google Ads
attachments.text: Interested in the 5 Google Ads strategies that brought in $2MM+ revenue for this Ecommerce Direct-To-Consumer brand? We'll start with...
attachments.fallback: October Marketing: [Growth Study] $2,848,821 For A Direct-To-Consumer Ecommerce Brand Using Google Ads

text: Hello! Not all of our members are guys. In an effort to be more conscious of the language we use to address each other, why not try “Hey, folks,” or “Hey everyone” instead?
